alert.note: Alert for Coastal Cumberland (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 05 at 3:56PM EDT by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of south central Cumberland County through 430 PM EDT... At 356 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over South Portland, moving southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Portland, South Portland, Westbrook, Cape Elizabeth, and Scarborough. This includes the following highways... Interstate 295 between mile markers 1 and 8. Interstate 95 between mile markers 44 and 48. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
